channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes maybe 8 in total, 6th December
item.description:
One is narrow and deep .one is very wide and shallow .road surface is terrible .all at junction of vicarage lane and mill lane brockworth .previous repairs are failing immediately and whole area needs a resurface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Vicarage Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: Very large Pothole, 6th December
item.description:
In the road outside 71 Linden Avenue This was reported on 23/11/25 and supposedly repaired on the 4th Dec obviously it wasn't. Reporting again as there has been a near miss between a cyclist and a car. Very dangerous as cars swerve to avoid it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Linden Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Long stretch of flooding due to blocked drain. Pedestrians getting soaked by passing traffic spraying the water onto the pavement. Water stays for hours /days after rain., 6th December

item.title: Wet leaves on pavement, 6th December
item.description:
Wet leaves on pavement from corner to past the bus stop, it’s slippery and dangerous when walking along this section of the path. This is a busy pavement and should be cleaned regularly at this time of year every year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Finlay Way is not fit for purpose, 6th December
item.description:
All of the drains (covers and Gulley's) and general condition of surface need to be replaced. The road is over 30years old and is subjected to increased levels of commercial traffic since being laid in the mid 90's. You also need to check with planning how this road is registered because its Findlay Way on some maps and Evesham road on others so could be the reason why its maintenance is falling through the cracks. Areas where it has been widened are not within the regulations and thus causing damage to adjoining properties. You need to stop wasting money patching it and rebuild/relay the road in a condition suitable for the tarffic

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
